instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-4924A: What is 820-4924A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.P3V3S0_EN: What is P3V3S0_EN? This signal enables the PP3V3_S0 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
I have a mac book with this main board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Laptop was liquid damaged. It is not turning on. Green and orange charger light is present. 
I found one issue main board was shorted on <TRANSISTOR>Q7320</TRANSISTOR>, liquid damage was in <CHIP>U7310</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7320</CHIP> area now this part looks ok,
I have 12v on <CAPACITOR>C7619</CAPACITOR>, P1v05 is present.
I fixed also <TRANSISTOR>Q8180</TRANSISTOR> it was liquid damaged too few resistors was missing this is fixed too. 

I don't have <SIGNAL>P3V3S0_EN</SIGNAL> any idea where or what I should check next ? 

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Shorted CPU Vcore FET so CPU is dead, RIP.
